net.hudup.core.client

Class ServerTrayIcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.TrayIcon
      • net.hudup.core.client.ServerTrayIcon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.EventListener, ServerStatusListener

    public class ServerTrayIcon
extends java.awt.TrayIcon
implements ServerStatusListener
    When server started, there is its icon shown on system tray of current operating system such as Windows and Linux. This class represents such tray icon of server. It also implements ServerStatusListener so that it can update itself; for example, it changes different icons according to different statuses such as running status, paused status, and stopped status.
    Version:
    11.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • updateStatus

        protected void updateStatus()
        ServerTrayIcon updates itself according to server status. For instance, ServerTrayIcon changes different icons according to different statuses such as running status, paused status, and stopped status.

      • statusChanged

        public void statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent evt)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ServerStatusListener
        Any class implementing this interface is responsible for defining this method statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent) to do some particular tasks when received server status event from server.
        Specified by:
        statusChanged in interface ServerStatusListener
        Parameters:
        evt - specified status event received from Server.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • getMessage

        protected java.lang.String getMessage(java.lang.String key)
        Getting a value (called message) of the specified key in server configuration. This method also supports internationalization (I18n) and so the returned message is localized according to the pre-defined language.
        Parameters:
        key - specified key.
        Returns:
        message according to key.
